Record.ClassificationPath: Nervous System Diseases/Central Nervous System Diseases/Brain Diseases/Headache Disorders/Headache Disorders, Primary/Migraine Disorders/Migraine without Aura
Record.Description: Recurrent unilateral pulsatile headaches, not preceded or accompanied by an aura, in attacks lasting 4-72 hours. It is characterized by PAIN of moderate to severe intensity; aggravated by physical activity; and associated with NAUSEA and / or PHOTOPHOBIA and PHONOPHOBIA. (International Classification of Headache Disorders, 2nd ed. Cephalalgia 2004: suppl 1)
